(6) We must make available to our "self-educators" a rich
repertory of resources. Opportunities for learning many
things, at many levels, in many ways, at many times. As
only one of these resources, television does not replace
but significantly can reinforce the effectiveness of other
instruments of learning.
(7) Bacause learning takes place within the learner, and not on
the television screen, television is at its best when it
oreates opportunities which will invite and stimulate
